TypeSignature.Value: .class public auto ansi sealed DeleteBehavior extends System.Enum

Docs.summary: Indicates how a delete operation is applied to dependent entities in a relationship when the principal is deleted or the relationship is severed.

MemberSignature.Value: .field public static literal valuetype Microsoft.EntityFrameworkCore.Metadata.DeleteBehavior Cascade = int32(2)

Docs.summary: Dependent entities are also deleted. This cascading behavior is only applied to entities that are being tracked by the context. A corresponding cascade behavior should be setup in the database to ensure data that is not being tracked by the context has the same action applied. If you use EF to create the database, this cascade behavior will be setup for you.

MemberSignature.Value: .field public static literal valuetype Microsoft.EntityFrameworkCore.Metadata.DeleteBehavior Restrict = int32(0)

Docs.summary: The delete operation is not applied to dependent entities. The dependent entities remain unchanged.

MemberSignature.Value: .field public static literal valuetype Microsoft.EntityFrameworkCore.Metadata.DeleteBehavior SetNull = int32(1)

Docs.summary: The foreign key properties in dependent entities are set to null. This cascading behavior is only applied to entities that are being tracked by the context. A corresponding cascade behavior should be setup in the database to ensure data that is not being tracked by the context has the same action applied. If you use EF to create the database, this cascade behavior will be setup for you.
